com.google.gxp.compiler.fs
Interface FileSystem

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFileSystem, DummyFileSystem, InMemoryFileSystem, ResourceFileSystem, SourcePathFileSystem, SystemFileSystem
public interface FileSystem

Provides a means for opening named "files" for reading or writing, and also doing any other file-system operations. Most of these operations are actually accessed via FileRef objects, while this class acts as a factory, creating FileRef objects out of filesystem-specific names for files.

Note that this is not intended to be a "complete" file-system interface. It currently only contains things needed by the GXP compiler.

Method Summary
 Charset getDefaultCharset()
           
 FileRef getRoot()

Method Detail

getRoot

FileRef getRoot()
Returns a FileRef for the root of this FileSystem. The the abstract name of the root is always "/".

parseFilename

FileRef parseFilename(String filename)
Parses a filename (for this filesystem) into a FileRef.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if filename cannot be parsed into a FileRef.

parseFilenameList

List<FileRef> parseFilenameList(String filenameList)
Parses a system path in this filesystem into an list of abstract FileRef objects. A "system path" is a string that specifies a list of filenames. These are typically used for search paths, eg: class path, library path, command path, etc. They are usually represented by some number of system filenames separated by a system-specific delimiter, but the actual representation is implementation specific.

Returns:
an Unmodifiable List of FileRefs
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if filename cannot be parsed into a list of FileRefs.

getDefaultCharset

Charset getDefaultCharset()
Returns:
the default Charset for this FileSystem.
